snippet: Some moderate Republican and independent women — a key swing group — have felt alienated by the focus in the presidential race on abortion and birth control.
abstract: Some moderate Republican and independent women--a key swing group--have felt alienated by the Republican focus in the presidential race on social issues like abortion and birth control; some of them say they might switch sides and vote for Pres Obama, if they vote at all.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rob Davis from San Diego, Dan Frosch from Denver, Ian Lovett from Los Angeles, Malia Wollan from San Francisco and Steven Yaccino from Chicago. Allison Kopicki contributed analysis.

lead_paragraph: Some moderate Republican and independent women — a key swing group — have felt alienated by the focus in the presidential race on abortion and birth control.

headline.main: Centrist Women Tell of Disenchantment With Republicans
headline.print_headline: Centrist Women Tell of Disenchantment With G.O.P.
